data.title: It's a great destination
data.text: My 5 year old grandson absolutely loved the museum!  He was busy for 3 hours and did not want to leave. He is a builder, so he loved the "marble machine-like" wall.  There were so many activities that kept him active and thinking.

data.title: family
data.text:
it is a nice place but too pricey
they even charge for 1 yr old
i will not reccommend it
trip can easily cost 50 dollars
in my opinion, it is not worth it

owner_response.author: CMHouston80, Public Relations Manager at Fort Bend Children's Discovery Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Poonam, 

Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience at the Fort Bend Children’s Discovery Center. We value all of our visitors’ feedback and we’re always seeking new ways to improve. Please note that children under 1 year of age have free admission. If you’d like to save on your admission please take advantage of our Power Hour between 5-6 p.m., which saves you $2. We recommend for you to review the current calendar of events and activities at www.childrensdiscoveryfb.org and thus plan the experience you wish to have when you do visit us again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Nice play with lots to keep the kids busy
data.text:
We enjoy it here. My son who is just  4years was very busy for over 2hr. 
Older kids would probably make more sense out of the whole experience.  But overall very good.
Nothing to eat or drink though. They only had a very tiny snack bar by the entrance with just crisps.

data.title: Discovery Experiences Close to Home
data.text: It's wonderful to have a meaningful learning experience for Fort Bend area children to go to, rather than having to travel into Houston for challenging and fun learning experiences. My six year old granddaughter enjoyed the two hours we were there. However, many of the exhibits required more participation and explanation (of how to do them) from me than I expected. In other words, most of the exhibits seemed geared towards older elementary age children rather than to younger or pre-school age children, who can't read. I also think the price is a bit high, making it more of a once or twice a year excursion, rather than a more frequent one. I love that the "town" was created using local stores and businesses. My granddaughter's favorite experience was "working" at the soda fountain.

data.title: Great for a couple of hours of fun!
data.text: We got in free with our Children's Museum of Houston family membership. The museum has a lot of similar exhibits and activities for kids to do as its larger Houston counterpart. We have found that arriving a couple of hours before closing time is nice if you are looking for a less crowded visit. My 7 year old loves it, but is hoping for an outdoor water exhibit in the future like the one in Houston. It's nice to have an option that is much closer to home. We will definitely continue to visit!

data.title: Smaller Version of Children's Museum Houston
data.text: We brought our grandchildren to this venue after finding out about its existence.  We travelled on Monday to the Children's Museum Houston so we were able to make a comparison. There is free parking at the venue in Sugar Land.  You save $9.00.  The facility is still under construction and does not include many of the features of the Houston facility yet.  The admission however is the same $12.00.  This venue is much smaller.  It opened in May and word has not gotten around about its existence so it is less crowded.  There are many opportunities for play and learning at this venue.  Puzzle and/or lego pieces at both venues were well worn and hard to get to work.  There is no place to grab a snack other than a vending machine at this location.  Oil pastels were available for face painting which is not easy to wash off.  Unique exhibits held the kids attention for @ 2 hours.  When the construction is complete, the venue will definitely be an alternate to driving downtown and facing huge crowds.

data.title: Fabulous for children
data.text: We entered free with our membership to the main Childrens Museum in the museum district.  The staff was very friendly and the museum was well organized.  Our eight-year-old had a wonderful time and wants to return.  There is also a large, separate area for toddlers up to three years.   Don't miss it if you live in the area!

data.title: A Day trip with my wife & 2 children
data.text:
Small size children's museum, very well distributed, clean and organized; the good part is that is not as crowded as the one in Houston. If you have the membership from the Children's museum in Houston, you can get in this one for free.

Come to the museum at around 10am, there is a farmers market at the side that you can check out, it's very nice! Then get into the children's museum, for lunch Chick-fil-A  at River Park Shopping Center would be a good choice to continue with the  Sugar Land Memorial Park and Brazos River Corridor. If you are visiting during summer, you can continue to the RiverPark Splash pad located at 5875 Summit Creek, Sugar Land, TX 77479. This is a park with a lot of stuff for kids.

The above trip will take a full day, so bring swimming suits, towels and pajamas for your kids.

data.title: Hate to Let the Cat out Of the Bag!
data.text:
This place is awesome!!

After much anticipation by the community and I am sure many years in the works, we now have a branch of the Houston Children's Museum right here in Sugar Land.

I live in a nearby neighborhood and cannot tell you how delighted I am.

This place has been been built on the existing site of the old Imperial Sugar Factory. In my opinion this is Sugar Land proper and has gotten the short end of the stick so far.

A few years down the road, I will probably eat my words, or even want to move away. The development is sweet and scary at the same time.

Being a nearby resident, I am keeping my fingers crossed that the development of the area will continue to provide this type of family oriented venue.

We do not, I repeat do not need an alcohol serving movie theater at this location. Thank you. Drink your drinks in your own backyard.

Okay, back to the museum itself. It is the perfect size. For now you can park in a nice sized existing lot right in front of the old silos. 

This place is a true blessing as the heat of summer creeps in. 

It is your typical Children's museum with a series of venues inside for the kiddies.

The currect exhibits are:    Cyberchase – The Chase is On!, Dragons & Fairies, How Does It Work?, Kidtropolis, Tot*Spot.

We visited with two very excited little brothers. One was aged 3 and a half, the other 1 and a half.

The pricing is $12 for everyone, kids included. Only children under one are free. I feel they could have been a little more relaxed on kid pricing, but oh well.

Seniors are $11 (not sure of the age).

The kids were thrilled by it all. Plenty of fun things to keep them occupied. 

We had a fourteen year old with us as well and she was not bored.

I splurged and went for the $175 membership which will get us in for free for a year. This extends to 8 people and you just have to list three adults on a form. They then asked that one of those three adults be in the group if you bring in friends, etc.

They have lesser memberships. I think everyone should show support and become a member!!!!!

We need this place. Remember when they had the satellite place in town center years ago? Well this is the result.

I could not be happier. Thank you to the George Foundation of Richmond for providing funding. Along with all the others who donated to make this place possible.

I hope it brings lots of joy to the community for years to come.

Signed,

Very Happy Grandma

owner_response.author: CMHouston80, Public Relations Manager at Fort Bend Children's Discovery Center, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thank you so much for taking the time to review our all-new Fort Bend Children's Discovery Center. We are so happy your and your grandchildren enjoyed it. We look forward to seeing you for many years to come. 

Best regards, 

The Children's Museum of Houston
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Paradijs voor kinderen
data.text: Bijzonder museum waarin kinderen actief en leuk bezig kunnen zijn. Absolute aanrader waar je met kinderen meerdere uren kan verblijven.
